sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The dying tears of a true lover forsaken, made on his death-bed; the hour before his death. To the tune of, Come live with me.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, J. Clarke, W. Thackeray, and T. Passinger., [London] : [between 1678-1681]
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing. The names of the lovers are said to have been Hugh Hill and Sarah. Verse: "Those gentle hearts that true love crave ..." Item at A5:2[108] trimmed. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
=======
